title: Chapter 200: Given A Critical Hit
body:
Chapter 200: Given A Critical Hit

I present to you the stubborn father and son duo


Lu Ting Xiao simply looked back, his eyes were like a gentle breeze over a lake, although there are ripples, it soon returns to calm. He knew that sooner or later this day would come, and he had been patiently waiting.


Although this time he was treading on thin ice, with a few near misses, it had now become the best-case scenario he could envision.


He has to do what he need to.


Looking at his brother’s expression, Lu Jingli couldn’t help but be worried for him.


His brother had simply been too restrained all his life. The past few months he had really changed. Ever since he met Ning Xi, it could be said that he had been reborn.


He really didn’t want him to revert back to his old behavior, and become even more frightening.


He decided he would go to the temple tomorrow for his brother and kneel for awhile. ……… Instead of looking at the manuscript, Ning Xi had been lying in bed for more than two hours.


There was nothing in her mind, it was completely blank. When she met a situation that’s extremely difficult to resolve, she would try to ease the pressure in a productive matter. When that didn’t work, she would have to find a more extreme method……


But it had been such a long time since she’d been bothered by something this difficult.


Looking at the clock on the wall, the time was almost ten o’clock. Ning Xi got up and reviewed the information Lin Zhizhi gave her. It took her an hour to memorize it all.


Her lines were solid, after all these things were quite simple.


At this time, she found it strange that the little bun hadn’t come to see her all night. Lu Ting Xiao had probably told Little Treasure that she was busy.


After memorizing the information, Ning Xi was ready to see the little bun.


When she got to the little bun’s room, Ning Xi thought he must be sleeping and pushed the door open gently.


As a result, through the crack she could see warm yellow lights on beside the bed.


She saw the little bun sitting on his bed focused entirely on his Rubik’s cube. Lu Ting Xiao was also sitting on the bed, his cold face showing a hint of frustration.


“It’s now 10:54. There are six minutes until eleven” Lu Ting Xiao said. The implied meaning was it’s late, go to sleep. The little bun continued playing as if he didn’t hear anything. He continued turning the cube around, taking a few seconds to assemble each side to make the colors consistent. Then he dismantled it and repeated the process.


Lu Ting Xiao picked up a book up from the drawers next to the bed. The cover had flowers, a small rabbit and a wolf’s face; a book of fairy tales. His face expressionless, he asked Little Treasure, “Want to hear it?”


Little treasure finally looked up and stared at Lu Ting Xiao, his eyes full of disdain.


Lu Ting Xiao pinched the bridge of his nose, “Book about a prince?”


Little Treasure glared.


“A brief history of time?” Little Treasure ignored him.


Lu Ting Xiao finally gave up, looking at his watch, his face became gloomy, “It’s already eleven o’clock.”


Seeing that Lu Ting Xiao was about to get angry, Ning Xi quickly knocked on the door, opening it fully.


“Little Treasure darling, why are you still up?”Ning Xi asked.


Before she finished speaking, the little bun has dashed off the bed like a small whirlwind throwing away his cube. He quickly clung to her calf, his small head upturned, his large eyes blinking sweetly at her. Ning Xi’s heart twanged, unable to take the cuteness.
